SEARCH
Package gw.api.inboundfile

Interface InboundFileHandler

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseInboundFileHandler
public interface InboundFileHandler
There is a base implementation that you can use BaseInboundFileHandler, if you want to process the entire file as a record, just override the getReader method.

    canEdit(@NotNull InboundRecord record, InboundSubRecord subRecord)

  • Method Details

    • getInboundFileConfig

      InboundFileConfig getInboundFileConfig()
      This will return the configuration for this handler
      Returns:
      InboundFileConfig

    • isFileValid

      boolean isFileValid(InboundInputFile file)
      Check to see if a file is valid. If a file is not valid, it will be marked as error, and the OnLoadError method of this handler will be called. Implementer note -- if you don't want to create any records for this file and set the file to error return false.
      Parameters:
      file - the file object.
      Returns:
      true if the file is valid, false if not.

    • createReader

      InboundRecordReader createReader(InboundFile inboundFileBean, InputStream inputStream, AtomicInteger lineCounter) throws IOException
      Constructs a new reader that constructs InboundRecords from the given inputStream Implementer note -- there is a abstract base class for the reader InboundRecordReader as well as YamlInboundRecordReader and JsonInboundRecordReader and YamlMultiDocTextRecordReader. But this must be implemented.
      Parameters:
      inboundFileBean - the InboundFile entity.
      inputStream - the inputStream from the InboundInputFile
      lineCounter - an atomic integer to maintain the line number. Passed by reference so that it can be added to exceptions and created records
      Returns:
      the reader
      Throws:
      IOException

    • preProcess

      void preProcess(InboundChunk chunk, IntentionalLogger logger, org.slf4j.Marker marker)
      Perform any necessary pre-processing, prior to processing the chunk's Inbound Records. Implementer note -- this is optional functionality. The chunk is in the bundle that will be committed with the records and postProcessing. The base implementation does nothing. If this throws an exception the work item will be tried again later.
      Parameters:
      chunk - the chunk being processed
      logger - the logger for capturing these events in the cluster.
      marker - the marker assigned to this caller location.

    • process

      void process(InboundRecord record, Bundle bundle, IntentionalLogger logger, org.slf4j.Marker marker) throws InboundFileProcessingException
      Process an Inbound Record, and any associated Inbound SubRecords. Note that the bundle passed in is shared by all records in the chunk and will be committed after all records are processed. If no exception is thrown from this method the record is marked InboundRecordStatus.TC_PROCESSED otherwise InboundRecordStatus.TC_ERROR Implementation note - this is where the real work is done. The records were created while iterating over the inbound reader in the batch process. This is called in the work queue for individual records in the chunk.
      Parameters:
      record - the Inbound Record.
      bundle - the bundle to use for processing any additional entities (this is the same bundle as the Inbound Record).
      logger - the logger for capturing these events in the cluster.
      marker - the marker assigned to this caller location.
      Throws:
      InboundFileProcessingException

    • postProcess

      void postProcess(InboundChunk chunk, IntentionalLogger logger, org.slf4j.Marker marker)
      Perform any necessary post-processing, after processing all the InboundRecords in this chunk. Implementer note -- this is optional functionality. The chunk is in the same bundle as all the records and will be committed after this call. The base implementation does nothing. If this throws an exception it will cause the commit to be bypassed and the work item will be tried again later.
      Parameters:
      chunk - the chunk being processed
      logger - the logger for capturing these events in the cluster.
      marker - the marker assigned to this caller location.

    • onLoadError

      void onLoadError(InboundFile file, String msg, IntentionalLogger logger, org.slf4j.Marker marker)
      Callback to perform additional error handling when an exception is encountered loading an Inbound File, such as logging or emailing an administrator. Implementer note -- the BaseInboundFileHandler.onLoadError(InboundFile, String, IntentionalLogger, Marker) logs, so call super in your method This is called outside of the commit block so you will need to use Transaction.runWithNewBundle to create or update any records and commit.
      Parameters:
      file - the Inbound File that failed to load.
      msg - a message.
      logger - the logger for capturing these events in the cluster.
      marker - the marker assigned to this caller location.

    • onLoadSuccess

      default void onLoadSuccess(InboundFile inboundFileBean, int numberOfChunks, int numberOfRecords)
      Callback to perform additional actions on successful parsing and writing of records. Implementer note -- this will be called before the commit so that you can use the inboundFileBean.Bundle to create a outbound success record. This has the benefit that if the commit of the work fails, it will fail for any records created here.
      Parameters:
      inboundFileBean - the file parsed
      numberOfChunks - the number of chunks written
      numberOfRecords - the number of records written

    • onProcessError

      void onProcessError(InboundRecord record, String msg, IntentionalLogger logger, org.slf4j.Marker marker)
      Callback to perform additional error handling when an exception is encountered processing an Inbound Record, such as logging or emailing an administrator. Implementer note -- the BaseInboundFileHandler.onProcessError(InboundRecord, String, IntentionalLogger, Marker) logs, so call super in your method. The status will be set to Error, and ErrorMessage will be set to the exception message.
      Parameters:
      record - the Inbound Record that failed to process.
      msg - a message.
      logger - the logger for capturing these events in the cluster.
      marker - the marker assigned to this caller location.

    • calculatePurgeDate

      Date calculatePurgeDate(InboundFile inboundFile)
      This will set the purge date. Implementer note -- this method is using the InboundFileConfig.getDaysTillPurge(), so normally you don't want to change this. However, you might want to set the purge date based on status as well.
      Parameters:
      inboundFile - the InboundFile entity
      Returns:
      the date to set as purge date

    • canView

      default boolean canView(@NotNull @NotNull InboundRecord record, InboundSubRecord subRecord)
      Whether the current user can view the current content Implementer note -- The default is ServerUtil.isLowerPlanet() some other useful methods are User with custom permissions. Or if these records never contain PII then just return true.
      Parameters:
      record - record
      subRecord - if this is asking about a record this will be null
      Returns:
      whether the user can view the content

    • canEdit

      default boolean canEdit(@NotNull @NotNull InboundRecord record, InboundSubRecord subRecord)
      Whether the current user can edit the current content Implementer note -- The default is ServerUtil.isLowerPlanet() some other useful methods are User with custom permissions. Or if these records do not expose any risk then just return true.
      Parameters:
      record - record
      subRecord - if this is asking about a record the sub record will be null
      Returns:
      whether the user can edit the content
